sentence.Network_en: Her voice will drop to a dismissive whisper.
sentence.Network_cn: 她会把声音压低，轻蔑地低语。
他们态度轻蔑，不屑一顾。

sentence.Network_en: He made a dismissive gesture. "Suit yourself."
sentence.Network_cn: 他做了一个很不屑的手势。“随你便。”

entry.tran: 拒绝考虑…的;对…轻视的;对…鄙视的
entry.def: If you are dismissive of someone or something, you say or show that you think they are not important or have no value.

example.ex: Mr Jones was dismissive of the report, saying it was riddled with inaccuracies.
example.tran: 琼斯先生对报告不屑一顾，称其中充斥着谬误。

example.ex: ...the dismissive attitude scientists often take in regard to questions such as telepathy or homeopathic medicine.
example.tran: 涉及心电感应、顺势疗法等问题时科学家们常抱有的鄙视态度

auth_sentence.content: Mr. Everett is himself wryly dismissive of his ploys.

Sentence.sentence: Your gut reaction (本能反应) and dismissive rejection, even of a worthless idea, might not qualify as systematic or fair.

means.word_mean: 轻视的, 轻蔑的, 鄙视的

sentences.en: She might have been less dismissive of my talents if he could have seen my latest achievements.
sentences.cn: 如果她看到我最近的成就, 她也许就不会那么小看我的才干了。
